reviews.review_msg: I enjoyed the content and guest lecturesâ€”some were excellent! However, I found it hard to stay engaged, as Dr. Gorski's lecture style didn't work for me. Exams were fair, but the writing assignments were tough and harshly graded. For a 3-credit course, the workload felt high.
She is very nice and kind prof. Exams were okay, but TA was very very tough marker. Expect specific words. Written assignments were fair.

Dr. Gorski is a lovely prof. She knows what she's talking about and she's a kind person. She's supportive and respectful during grad student presentations and when students ask questions in class. Exams are straightforward (if you study all the material, you'll do better than I did lol). The guest lecturers she brought in were interesting too.

Dr. Gorski is an expert in her field and her extensive knowledge in the field is very clearly visible during lectures. She is able to answer a wide variety of questions that may come up, and is very open to clarifying concepts. The exams were straightforward, and she is very accessible outside of class. Just wish there was more practice material.
Enjoyed this class.  The tests were straight forward but the written assignments were difficult (although  the average on both was absurdly high).

Nice prof and fair exams, but has a VERY hard marking TA as she has no time to mark. Looks for specific words in your answers. Does NOT give part marks for similar correct answers. Overall a good course with interesting topics about cancer, no textbook needed. But lots of guest lectures to make your studying even more difficult.
